00021 #pragma once
00022 
00023 #include <l4/cxx/arith>
00024 
00025 namespace cxx {
00026 
00030 class List_alloc
00031 {
00032 private:
00033   friend class List_alloc_sanity_guard;
00034 
00035   struct Mem_block
00036   {
00037     Mem_block *next;
00038     unsigned long size;
00039   };
00040 
00041   Mem_block *_first;
00042 
00043   inline void check_overlap(void *, unsigned long );
00044   inline void sanity_check_list(char const *, char const *);
00045   inline void merge();
00046 
00047 public:
00048 
00055   List_alloc() : _first(0) {}
00056 
00066   inline void free(void *block, unsigned long size, bool initial_free = false);
00067 
00076   inline void *alloc(unsigned long size, unsigned align);
00077 
00083   inline unsigned long avail();
00084 };
00085 
00086 #if !defined (CXX_LIST_ALLOC_SANITY)
00087 class List_alloc_sanity_guard
00088 {
00089 public:
00090   List_alloc_sanity_guard(List_alloc *, char const *)
00091   {}
00092 
00093 };
00094 
00095 
00096 void 
00097 List_alloc::check_overlap(void *, unsigned long )
00098 {}
00099 
00100 void 
00101 List_alloc::sanity_check_list(char const *, char const *)
00102 {}
00103 
00104 #else
00105 
00106 class List_alloc_sanity_guard
00107 {
00108 private:
00109   List_alloc *a;
00110   char const *func;
00111   
00112 public:
00113   List_alloc_sanity_guard(List_alloc *a, char const *func)
00114     : a(a), func(func)
00115   { a->sanity_check_list(func, "entry"); }
00116   
00117   ~List_alloc_sanity_guard()
00118   { a->sanity_check_list(func, "exit"); }
00119 };
00120 
00121 void 
00122 List_alloc::check_overlap(void *b, unsigned long s)
00123 {
00124   unsigned long const mb_align = (1UL << arith::Ld<sizeof(Mem_block)>::value) - 1;
00125   if ((unsigned long)b & mb_align)
00126     {
00127       L4::cerr << "List_alloc(FATAL): trying to free unaligned memory: "
00128          << b << " align=" << arith::Ld<sizeof(Mem_block)>::value << "\n";
00129     }
00130 
00131   Mem_block *c = _first;
00132   for (;c ; c = c->next)
00133     {
00134       unsigned long x_s = (unsigned long)b;
00135       unsigned long x_e = x_s + s;
00136       unsigned long b_s = (unsigned long)c;
00137       unsigned long b_e = b_s + c->size;
00138 
00139       if (   (x_s >= b_s && x_s < b_e)
00140     || (x_e > b_s && x_e <= b_e)
00141     || (b_s >= x_s && b_s < x_e)
00142     || (b_e > x_s && b_e <= x_e))
00143   {
00144     L4::cerr << "List_alloc(FATAL): trying to free memory that "
00145             "is already free: \n  ["
00146       << (void*)x_s << '-' << (void*)x_e << ") overlaps ["
00147       << (void*)b_s << '-' << (void*)b_e << ")\n";
00148   }
00149     }
00150 }
00151 
00152 void 
00153 List_alloc::sanity_check_list(char const *func, char const *info)
00154 {
00155   Mem_block *c = _first;
00156   for (;c ; c = c->next)
00157     {
00158       if (c->next)
00159   {
00160     if (c >= c->next)
00161       {
00162         L4::cerr << "List_alloc(FATAL): " << func << '(' << info 
00163     << "): list oerder violation\n";
00164       }
00165 
00166     if (((unsigned long)c) + c->size > (unsigned long)c->next)
00167       {
00168         L4::cerr << "List_alloc(FATAL): " << func << '(' << info 
00169     << "): list oerder violation\n";
00170       }
00171   }
00172     }
00173 }
00174 
00175 #endif
00176 
00177 void
00178 List_alloc::merge()
00179 {
00180   List_alloc_sanity_guard __attribute__((unused)) guard(this, __func__);
00181   Mem_block *c = _first;
00182   while (c && c->next)
00183     {
00184       unsigned long f_start = (unsigned long)c;
00185       unsigned long f_end   = f_start + c->size;
00186       unsigned long n_start = (unsigned long)c->next;
00187       
00188       if (f_end == n_start)
00189   {
00190     c->size += c->next->size;
00191     c->next = c->next->next;
00192     continue;
00193   }
00194 
00195       c = c->next;
00196     }
00197 }
00198 
00199 void 
00200 List_alloc::free(void *block, unsigned long size, bool initial_free)
00201 {
00202   List_alloc_sanity_guard __attribute__((unused)) guard(this, __func__);
00203 
00204   unsigned long const mb_align = (1UL << arith::Ld<sizeof(Mem_block)>::value) - 1;
00205 
00206   if (initial_free)
00207     {
00208       // enforce alignment constraint on initial memory
00209       block = (void*)(((unsigned long)block + mb_align) & ~mb_align);
00210       size &= ~mb_align;
00211     }
00212   else
00213     // blow up size to the minimum aligned size
00214     size = (size + mb_align) & ~mb_align;
00215 
00216   check_overlap(block, size);
00217   
00218   Mem_block **c = &_first;
00219   Mem_block *next = 0;
00220   
00221   if (*c)
00222     {
00223       while (*c && *c < block)
00224   c = &(*c)->next;
00225 
00226       next = *c;
00227     }
00228   
00229   *c = (Mem_block*)block;
00230   
00231   (*c)->next = next;
00232   (*c)->size = size;
00233 
00234   merge();
00235 }
00236 
00237 void *
00238 List_alloc::alloc(unsigned long size, unsigned align)
00239 {
00240   List_alloc_sanity_guard __attribute__((unused)) guard(this, __func__);
00241   
00242   unsigned long const mb_align = (1UL << arith::Ld<sizeof(Mem_block)>::value) - 1;
00243 
00244   // blow up size to the minimum aligned size
00245   size = (size + mb_align) & ~mb_align;
00246 
00247   unsigned long almask = align ? (align -1) : 0;
00248 
00249   // minimum alignment is given by the size of a Mem_block
00250   if (almask < mb_align)
00251     almask = mb_align;
00252 
00253   Mem_block **c = &_first;
00254 
00255   for (; *c; c=&(*c)->next)
00256     {
00257       // address of free memory block
00258       unsigned long n_start = (unsigned long)(*c);
00259 
00260       // block too small, next
00261       // XXX: maybe we can skip this and just do the test below
00262       if ((*c)->size < size)
00263   continue;
00264 
00265       // aligned start address within the free block
00266       unsigned long a_start = (n_start + almask) & ~almask;
00267 
00268       // hm, block too small after alignment, next
00269       if (a_start - n_start >= (*c)->size)
00270   continue;
00271 
00272       // remaining size after subtracting the padding
00273       // for the alignment
00274       unsigned long r_size = (*c)->size - a_start + n_start;
00275 
00276       // block too small
00277       if (r_size < size)
00278   continue;
00279 
00280       if (a_start < n_start)
00281   {
00282     // have free space before the allocated block
00283     // shrink the block and set c to the next pointer of that
00284     // block
00285     (*c)->size -= r_size;
00286     c = &(*c)->next;
00287   }
00288       else
00289   // drop the block, c remains the next pointer of the
00290   // previous block
00291   *c = (*c)->next;
00292 
00293       // allocated the whole remaining space
00294       if (r_size == size)
00295   return (void*)a_start;
00296 
00297       // add a new free block behind the allocated block
00298       Mem_block *m = (Mem_block*)(a_start + size);
00299       m->next = *c;
00300       m->size = r_size - size;
00301       *c = m;
00302       return (void*)a_start;
00303     }
00304 
00305   return 0;
00306 }
00307 
00308 unsigned long
00309 List_alloc::avail()
00310 {
00311   List_alloc_sanity_guard __attribute__((unused)) guard(this, __FUNCTION__);
00312   Mem_block *c = _first;
00313   unsigned long a = 0;
00314   while (c)
00315     {
00316       a += c->size;
00317       c = c->next;
00318     }
00319 
00320   return a;
00321 }
00322 
00323 
00324 }
